1.text: And Job will answer and say,

2.text: Verily that ye are the people, and shall wisdom die with you?

3.text: Also to me a heart like you; I fall not more than you: and with whom not like these?

4.text: I shall be he laughing at his neighbor, calling to God, and he will answer him: the just blameless one being laughed at.

5.text: To misfortune is contempt to the thoughts of him at ease, being prepared for the waverings of the foot.

6.text: The tents to those oppressing will be secure, and confidence to those provoking God to anger: whom God will bring into his hand.

7.text: But ask now the beasts and they shall teach thee; and the birds of the heavens, and they shall announce to thee:

8.text: Or speak to the earth and it shall teach thee; and the fishes of the sea shall recount to thee.

9.text: Who knew not in all these that the hand of God did this?

10.text: Which in his hand the soul of all living, and the spirit of all the flesh of man.

11.text: Shall not the ear try words? and the palate shall taste food to it?

12.text: With old men is wisdom, and length of days, understanding.

13.text: With him wisdom and strength, to him counsel and understanding.

14.text: Behold, he will pull down and it shall not be built up: he will shut up against man and it shall not be opened.

15.text: Behold, he will hold back upon the waters, and they will dry up: and he will send them forth and they will overturn the earth.

16.text: With him strength and purpose: to him the one led astray and him leading astray.

17.text: Leading away counselors stripped off and he will make foolish the judges.

18.text: He loosed the bonds of kings, and he will gird upon their loins a girdle.

19.text: Leading away priests stripped off, and he will overthrow the mighty.

20.text: Removing the lip to the faithful, and he will take discernment of old men.

21.text: Proving contempt upon nobles, and he slackened the girdle of the strong.

22.text: Revealing deep things from darkness, and he will bring to light the shadow of death.

23.text: Making great to the nations, and he will destroy them: he spread out to the nations, and he will guide them.

24.text: Taking away the heart of the heads of the people of the earth, and he will cause them to wander in a waste, not a way.

25.text: They will feel darkness and not light, and he will cause them to wander as one intoxicated.
